New Records: Keon Ellis made a falling-sideways three pointer to beat the buzzer in the first quarter
Key Match Events: The Kings clawed back in the second quarter, closing the gap and trailing 60-56 at the half
The Kings allowed a Mavericks run in the third, with Dallas pushing their lead to 9 at one point, but from the halfway mark of the 3rd, it was like a whole different Kings team
Doug Christie got to send in the third string to close out his first win as head coach, and the Kings won 110-100
Pre-Game Insights: Experts did not favor the Kings to win based on their recent performance
Coach Doug Christie emphasized the importance of strong team effort and energy
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
The Kings' win was a crucial step toward improving their season record
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on New Year's Eve, and the Kings won to ring in the new year
The Kings' win was their first under new head coach Doug Christie
Others: De'Aaron Fox had a big game with 33 points, 6 assists, 6 rebounds, and 1 steal
Domantas Sabonis had a very good game with 17 points, 16 rebounds, 7 assists, and 1 steal
The Kings' bench production was a key factor in their win, with Keon Ellis and Trey Lyles playing well
